content: round repeat rnds 3 & 4 only 3 more times you will have 76 sts knit all rnds even until piece measures 2 ½ from cast on edge as measured from a flat side not a point bowl shaping decreases round 1 *knit to 2 sts before marker k2tog remove marker repeat from * 3 more times but do not remove the end of round marker round 2 knit around round 3 *k7 k2tog repeat from * 7 more times round 4 knit around round 5 *k6 k2tog repeat from * 7 more times round 6 knit around round 7 *k5 k2tog repeat from * 7 more times round 8 knit around round 9 *k4 k2tog repeat from * 7 more times round 10 knit around round 11 *k3 k2tog repeat from * 7 more times round 12 knit around round 13 k2 k2tog repeat from * 7 more times round 14 knit around round 15 *k1 k2tog repeat from * 7 more times round 16 k2tog 8 times you will have 8 sts remaining cut yarn leaving a 10 tail using a tapestry needle thread yarn through the remaining 8 sts pull together snugly and secure well darning in center yarn end to wrong side assembly & finishing place one bowl inside the other with wrong sides touching and right sides facing outwards towards you align the 4 pointy corners and beginning/ending of rnds somewhat together this is also your opportunity to use a contrasting color yarn if desired for bowls started with a normal cast on method thread a length of yarn onto a tapestry needle and carefully whip stitch or weave the two cast on edges together you may also use a simple or fancy crochet edging of your choice for bowls started with a provisional cast on method carefully remove the waste yarn from one bowl piece and place all 116 sts onto the circular needle from the second bowl carefully remove the waste yarn from a portion of the sts and place onto a double point needle or second circular needle working with the circular needle knit 2 sts together taking one from the first piece and one from the second piece release additional sts from the waste yarn in groups as needed when all 116 sts are on one circular needle bind off you may also use a simple or fancy crochet edging instead of the bind off weave in yarn ends enjoy ©copyright terry liann morris 2019 questions comments email
